required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Investigation of Three Approaches to Address Fear of Recurrence Among Breast Cancer Survivors
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of Three Approaches to Address Fear of Recurrence Among Breast Cancer Survivors: A Randomized Clinical Pilot Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Fear of cancer recurrence (FCR) is one of the most prevalent, persistent, and disruptive sources of distress for adult cancer survivors. Prevalence rates for FCR have been estimated at up to 89%, with approximately half of cancer survivors reporting clinically significant levels of FCR. Despite the recognized prevalence, persistence, and suffering associated with FCR, effective and accessible treatments for FCR are lacking and urgently needed. Our long-term goal is to develop, evaluate, and implement effective behavioral interventions for cancer survivors suffering with FCR.

study_design_info.masking_description: Participants were blinded to study hypotheses.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in fear of recurrence (FCR) at Post-Intervention, 1-month, and 6-month follow-up as assessed by Fear of Cancer Recurrence Inventory (FCRI).
primary_outcome.description: As measured by Fear of Cancer Recurrence Inventory (FCRI)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in fear of recurrence (FCR) at Post-Intervention, 1-month, and 6-month follow-up as assessed by Concerns about Recurrence Scale (CARS).
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by Concerns about Recurrence Scale (CARS)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in cancer-related avoidant coping at Post-Intervention, 1-month, and 6-month follow-up as assessed by Acceptance & Action Questionnaire-Cancer
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by Acceptance & Action Questionnaire-Cancer

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in anxiety at Post-Intervention, 1-month, and 6-month follow-up as assessed Generalized Anxiety Disorder Scale (GAD-7).
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by Generalized Anxiety Disorder Scale (GAD-7)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in depression at Post-Intervention, 1-month, and 6-month follow-up as assessed by as measured by Patient Health Questionnaire Depression Scale (PHQ-8).
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by Patient Health Questionnaire Depression Scale (PHQ-8)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in post-traumatic stress symptoms at Post-Intervention, 1-month, and 6-month follow-up as assessed by Impact of Events Scale-Revised (IES-R).
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by Impact of Events Scale-Revised (IES-R)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in vitality at Post-Intervention, 1-month, and 6-month follow-up as assessed by Short Form(SF)-36 Vitality Scale.
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by Short Form(SF)-36 Vitality Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in Breast Cancer Self-Efficacy at Post-Intervention, 1-month, and 6-month follow-up as assessed by Breast Cancer Self-Efficacy Scale
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by Breast Cancer Self-Efficacy Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in quality of life at Post-Intervention, 1-month, and 6-month follow-up as assessed by 10-item PROMIS Global Health Scale
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by PROMIS Global Health Scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in spiritual well-being at Post-Intervention, 1-month, and 6-month follow-up as assessed by Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy-Spiritual Well-being (FACIT-Sp) scale
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy- Spiritual Well-being (FACIT-Sp) scale

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in mindfulness at Post-Intervention, 1-month, and 6-month follow-up as assessed by Five Facet Mindfulness Questionnaire-Short Form
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by Five Facet Mindfulness Questionnaire-Short Form

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in telomere length at Post-Intervention, 1-month, and 6-month follow-up as assessed by quantitative telomere length.
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by quantitative telomere length.

secondary_outcome.measure: Intervention ratings for satisfaction and helpfulness at Post-Intervention as assessed by a 5-item investigator-created measure.
secondary_outcome.description: As measured by a 5-item investigator-created measure of intervention satisfaction and helpfulness

arm_group.description: 6 weeks, the ACT group will meet weekly for 2 hours at one of three facilities.
6 weeks, SE group will meet weekly for 2 hours at one of three facilities.

Continue to meet with their health care team + receive a variety of readings at each data collection point on coping with common survivorship concerns, including a booklet from the National Cancer Institute entitled "Facing Forward: Life After Cancer Treatment."

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: Participants in this study will be eligible if they are:
1. age ≥18 years,
2. have been diagnosed with non-metastatic breast cancer (stages 0-III),
3. have completed curative treatment for breast cancer,
4. have not experienced a cancer recurrence, and
5. report a clinically significant level of FCR (as assessed with the Fear of Cancer Recurrence Inventory-Short Form ≥ 13)
Exclusion Criteria:
1. severe depression (PHQ-8 ≥ 20),
2. past participation in ACT or formal mindfulness training, and
3. limited English proficiency.

overall_official.affiliation: Indiana University School of Medicine; Regenstrief Institute, Inc.
